title: Field to Fork 2019: Best Management Practices to Produce More Potatoes

tasks.task: Conducting potato farming and breeding activities
subtasks: Explaining potato production in North Dakota and neighboring states
Planting potatoes with appropriate spacing and fertilization
Implementing hilling and weed control practices
Managing pests and diseases in the potato garden
Addressing common potato issues and disorders

tasks.task: Understand and perform potato agricultural practices

Let me think of the broader actions a farmer would take in potato production. So start with site preparation, planting, growing season management, harvest, and storage. Each of these would be MAINTASKs.
Prepare soil for potato planting
Plant potatoes
Manage potato crop during growing season
Harvest potatoes
Store harvested potatoes
Propagate and grow potato plants
Manage pests and diseases
Harvest and store potatoes
Understand and manage potato propagation and planting
Implement hill management practices
Apply fertilizer and manage soil moisture
Monitor and control pests and diseases
Harvest and store potatoes properly
Plant and care for potato crops
subtasks: Select and treat seed potatoes for propagation
Properly plant seed potatoes in prepared soil
Manage hills to protect developing tubers and prevent greening

tasks.task: Maintain potato plants and control pests/diseases
subtasks: Regularly monitor for common pests and diseases
Address visible signs of disease with appropriate measures

tasks.task: Harvest and store potatoes
subtasks: Monitor plant growth and soil conditions before harvesting
Harvest potatoes carefully to minimize damage

tasks.task: This includes the key actions covered in the presentation. Each MAINTASK has three to four subtasks, keeping it concise. Since the transcript is a presentation, not a hands-on demonstration, some practical steps like specific timings (e.g., planting after last frost) might not be included, but the main practices are there.
"Prepare soil for potato planting"). But since it was mentioned briefly in her speech, but given soil testing wasn't discussed, it’s probably part of general soil preparation.
Similarly, her mention of common issues like common scab can be captured in the MAINTASK related to pest and disease management.
MAINTASK: Conducting potato farming and breeding activities.
